about.pageSubtitle: Your trusted partner in Pattaya real estate since 2010
about.leadingAgency: Leading Real Estate Agency in Pattaya
about.paragraph1: PW Pattaya Global Real Estate Co., Ltd is one of the leading real estate agencies in Pattaya, Thailand. With over 15 years of experience, we have helped thousands of clients find their dream properties in this beautiful coastal city.
about.paragraph2: Our team of professional agents speaks multiple languages including English, German, Thai, Russian, and French, ensuring seamless communication with our international clientele.
about.paragraph3: Whether you're looking to buy, rent, or invest in Pattaya real estate, we provide comprehensive services tailored to your specific needs.
about.missionText: To provide exceptional real estate services that exceed client expectations, making property transactions in Pattaya transparent, efficient, and rewarding for both buyers and sellers.
about.visionText: To be the most trusted and preferred real estate agency in Pattaya, known for our integrity, professionalism, and commitment to helping people find their perfect property in paradise.
about.service1Description: Comprehensive buying and selling services for condos, houses, and land
about.service2Description: Long-term and short-term rental management and property matching
about.service3Description: Expert advice on property investment opportunities and market trends

faq.pageSubtitle: Find answers to common questions about buying, renting, and investing in Pattaya real estate
faq.buying1Question: Can foreigners buy property in Thailand?
faq.buying1Answer: Yes, foreigners can buy condominiums in Thailand with full freehold ownership, as long as the foreign ownership quota in the building does not exceed 49%. Foreigners cannot directly own land, but can lease it for up to 30 years (renewable) or set up a Thai company to purchase land.
faq.buying2Question: What are the costs involved in buying property?
faq.buying2Answer: Transfer fees are typically 2% of the property value (often split 50/50 between buyer and seller). Additional costs may include stamp duty (0.5%), withholding tax, specific business tax, and legal fees. Budget approximately 3-5% of the purchase price for all fees.
faq.buying3Question: How long does it take to complete a property purchase?
faq.buying3Answer: The process typically takes 4-8 weeks from offer acceptance to completion. This includes contract preparation, due diligence, mortgage approval (if applicable), and transfer at the Land Office.
faq.renting1Question: What documents do I need to rent a property?
faq.renting1Answer: You typically need a valid passport, visa (if applicable), proof of income or employment, and a deposit. Some landlords may also request references or a guarantor.
faq.renting2Question: How much deposit is required for renting?
faq.renting2Answer: The standard deposit is usually 2 months rent, plus 1 month advance rent. This may vary depending on the property and landlord. Deposits are refundable at the end of the lease, minus any damages or unpaid bills.
faq.legal1Question: What is a usufruct and how does it work?
faq.legal1Answer: A usufruct is a legal right that allows a foreigner to use and benefit from a property (including land) for up to 30 years, renewable. It can be registered at the Land Office and provides strong legal protection.
faq.legal2Question: Can I get a visa based on property ownership?
faq.legal2Answer: No, property ownership alone does not grant a visa. However, property owners can apply for other visa categories like retirement visa, business visa, or Thai Elite visa. Consult with immigration authorities for specific requirements.
faq.investment1Question: What is the average ROI for rental properties in Pattaya?
faq.investment1Answer: Rental yields in Pattaya typically range from 5-8% per year, depending on location, property type, and management. Popular tourist areas near the beach tend to offer higher yields.
faq.investment2Question: Are property prices increasing in Pattaya?
faq.investment2Answer: Pattaya property prices have shown steady growth over the past decade, averaging 3-5% per year. Prime beachfront locations and new developments tend to appreciate faster. Market conditions vary by area and property type.
faq.general1Question: What are the best areas to live in Pattaya?
faq.general1Answer: Popular areas include Wongamat Beach (quiet, upscale), Jomtien (family-friendly), Na Jomtien (peaceful), Pratumnak Hill (sea views), and Central Pattaya (convenient). The best area depends on your lifestyle preferences and budget.
faq.general2Question: What utilities and maintenance costs should I expect?
faq.general2Answer: Monthly costs typically include: electricity (‡∏ø1,500-3,000), water (‡∏ø150-300), internet (‡∏ø500-1,000), and condominium fees (‡∏ø30-80 per sqm). Costs vary based on usage and property size.
faq.general3Question: Is it safe to invest in Thai real estate?
faq.general3Answer: Yes, with proper due diligence and legal advice. Always use a reputable lawyer, verify ownership documents, check for encumbrances, and ensure the property has all necessary permits and approvals.
faq.ctaText: Our team is here to help. Contact us for personalized assistance with your real estate needs.
